Description: Sherd (base). With 6-petalled rosette and scroll.Inscription. Made of cobalt, white painted and glazed pottery (grey).
Curator's comments: On pottery with this signature: Y. Kanda, "Revisiting the So-called Ghaybī Workshop: Toward a History of Burjī Mamluk Ceramics", Orient 52 (2017) 39-57
Bibliographic references: Gibbs 1994 / Mamluk Underglaze-Decorated Wares: Some Evidence from Fustat (fig.76)
